articles.title: Kim Jong Un Provides Field Guidance to November 2 Factory of KPA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Provides Field Guidance to November 2 Factory of KPA
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, provided field guidance to the November 2 Factory of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The factory produces varieties of foodstuffs including confectionery and bread for service personnel.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, who is also KPA Supreme Commander, had given an instruction to the factory to build a modern snack production process to provide service personnel with tasty and nutritious snacks on a regular basis.
					
					 True to his instruction, KPA Unit 534 and officials and workers of the factory successfully built a production building with a large capacity as required by the new century in a short span of time. They are now keeping the snack production going at a high rate.
					
					 Kim Jong Un went round the hall dedicated to the history of the factory built in May 1947 at the initiative of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He looked back with deep emotion on the history of the factory developed under the deep care of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu who spared nothing for the service personnel.
					
					 He was very pleased with the construction of the new modern snack production process, noting it has become possible to realize the desire of the President and leader Kim Jong Il, who made so much effort in their lifetime to solve the issue of food for the service personnel.
					
					 Going round various places of the factory including candy and biscuit shops, he gave precious instructions to be implemented by the factory for its operation and management.
					
					 Dropping in at its combined control room, he called for thoroughly establishing modern monitoring, control and command systems to put the production processes on the computer basis.
					
					 It is the determination of the WPK to supply tasty and nutritious snacks and foodstuffs to service personnel on a regular basis, he said, underlining the need to boost production and improve the quality of products on the basis of the expanded production capacity of the factory.
					
					 Expressing the belief that the workers of the factory would successfully carry out their honorable duties, he set the goals to be attained by the factory in different phases. 
					
					 During his field guidance, Kim Jong Un was accompanied by KPA Vice Marshal Choe Ryong Hae, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, and Hwang Pyong So, vice department director of the Central Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Active Service Personnel for Political Work with Enemy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Active Service Personnel for Political Work with Enemy
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and  first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, had a photo session with the participants in the 4th meeting of active service personnel of KPA for political work with the enemy.
					 Present there together with him were Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Pyon In Son, Kim Su Gil and Ryom Chol Song.
					
					 He said that the service personnel for political work with the enemy reliably defend the forefront line for safeguarding the socialist system, firmly trusting and following the Party and leader only despite rain or snow, regardless of whether they are known or unknown. He highly appreciated exploits performed by them.
					
					 He had a photo taken with them, expressing expectation and conviction that they would creditably fulfill their heavy yet honorable mission, firmly convinced of the final victory of the cause of Songun revolution.
					
					 All the participants were filled with firm determination to thoroughly implement the militant tasks set forth in the historic letter of Kim Jong Un and the resolution made in their letter of pledge to him.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Makes Field Survey of Construction of Dormitory of Textile Mill
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Makes Field Survey of Construction of Dormitory of Textile Mill
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, made a field survey of the construction of dormitory of the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill.
					 Modern cultural and welfare establishments including dormitory for the workers of the mill are to be built under the warm loving care of supreme leader Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Soldier-builders are bringing about innovations in the construction in the "speed on Masik Pass", true to the noble intention of Kim Jong Un, who showed great love for the workers of the mill during his field guidance.
					
					 The director encouraged the soldier-builders to fully demonstrate the might of the revolutionary army, while looking round various places of the construction site.
					
					 He called on them to complete the construction in a short period under the slogan of "Let Us Help the People", true to the plan of the Supreme Commander.
					
					 He pressed for measures to make well-planned preparations to push forward the construction in coming winter season and fully provide facilities and equipment needed for the construction.

articles.title: Premier Makes Field Survey of Gwisong Saltern
articles.content:
Premier Makes Field Survey of Kwisong Saltern
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of Kwisong Saltern.
					 Scientists and technicians discovered a huge pool of underground ultra-saline water of great economic value, thereby opening up a prospect of drastically increasing salt production.
					
					 After going round several places of the saltern, the premier convened a consultative meeting of officials of relevant units to discuss increasing production based on newly explored salt resources.
					
					 It was mentioned at the meeting that the successful exploration of the underground ultra-saline water under the wise guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un will make it possible to carry out the last instructions of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il to put the salt production on an intensive basis.
					
					 The meeting also highlighted the significance of the underground ultra-saline water in improving the people's livelihood and developing the economy, and discussed issues for boosting the salt production.
					
					 The meeting also discussed measures for providing raw and other materials needed for the production by relevant units.
					
					 Earlier, the premier learned about the introduction of rice thresher manufactured by the Institute of Agricultural Mechanization of the Academy of Agricultural Science and called for making high-efficiency rice threshers suited to the specific conditions of the country.

articles.title: Minju Joson Raps U.S. Military Aid to S. Korea
articles.content:
Minju Joson Raps U.S. Military Aid to S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- It was reported that the U.S. Boeing company recently concluded a contract with a south Korean air industrial enterprise on improving MD 500 helicopters of south Korean puppet army to be drones like U.S.-made H6-U choppers. 
					 It was reported that the improved unmanned choppers would be used for spying on areas along the military demarcation line in Korea. 
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:  This reveals once again the true colors of the U.S. as a disturber of peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is focusing its political, diplomatic and military potentials on the Asia-Pacific region from the view that its vital interests hinge on the region. 
					
					 It is the scenario of the U.S. to achieve military supremacy by amassing its forces in the region and meet its strategic interests. 
					
					 The U.S. seeks constant tension and its escalation on the peninsula in an effort to secure a pretext for massively hurling its forces into the region, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					 This clearly indicates that the U.S. is the worst rogue state in the world as it makes no scruple of perpetrating any criminal act of straining the international situation and disturbing peace in pursuit of its own interests. 
					
					 The U.S. warmongers take a stance that everything is OK for the U.S. if it rakes up profits, not caring whether U.S.-made weapons purchased by south Korea cause a tragedy of fratricidal war or bring a war disaster to the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 Owing to this avarice of these warmongers, all forms of disputes lead to armed clashes not only on the peninsula but also in different parts of the world, leaving a lot of innocent civilians dead.

articles.title: Angolan President Reiterates His Will to Boost Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Angolan President Reiterates His Will to Boost Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Angola will continue to boost the relations with the friendly people of the DPRK.
					 Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of Angola, said this when meeting with Kim Hyon Il, DPRK ambassador to Angola, on Nov. 5.
					
					 He said Angola is very pleased that everything is going well in the DPRK under the wise guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He paid tribute to the Korean people making a triumphant advance despite challenges and difficulties caused by outside forces.

articles.title: Construction of Kaesong Latest Science, Technology Development Zone Starts
articles.content:
Construction of Kaesong Latest Science, Technology Development Zone Starts
 Kaesong, November 11 (KCNA) -- The ground-breaking ceremony for building the Latest Science and Technology Development Zone was held in Kaesong City on Monday.
					 Present there were Jang Su Nam, representative of the Peace and Economy Development Group, officials concerned, builders, employees of the zone and foreign figures concerned and guests.
					
					 Jang said in his address that the construction of the zone would help promote the friendship and develop the cooperation among various countries.
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK provides foreign businesses with all conditions for investment.
					
					 He expressed belief that the construction of the zone would be completed as soon as possible thanks to the positive efforts of the builders and figures concerned.
					
					 Then foreign figures made speeches.
					
					 They expressed conviction that the construction of the zone would contribute to promoting the economic development in the region and improving the Korean people's living standard.
					
					 They expressed hope that the figures concerned of various countries would support and encourage the successful construction of the zone.

articles.title: Anniversary of Opening of Diplomatic Relations between DPRK, Nordic Countries Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Opening of Diplomatic Ties between DPRK, Nordic Countries Marked
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of Nordic countries gave a reception at the Swedish embassy here on Tuesday on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Nordic countries.
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Kil Bok, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international bodies.
					
					 Present there were Karl-Olof Andersson, Swedish ambassador to the DPRK, Matti Heikki Heimonen, Finnish ambassador to the DPRK, Torbjorn Holthe, Norwegian ambassador to the DPRK, their embassy officials and the political councilor of the Danish embassy here.

articles.title: Communist Party of Portugal Supports WPK in Its Struggle
articles.content:
Communist Party of Portugal Supports WPK in Its Struggle 
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Jeronimo de Sousa, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Portugal, Sunday had a friendly talk with a delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) led by  Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of the Central Committee of the WPK. Ri Yong Chol was leading the delegation to attend the 15th international meeting of communist parties and workers' parties.
					 Jeronimo de Sousa said the Communist Party of Portugal would continue to voice full support and solidarity for the WPK in its struggle to achieve peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and peaceful reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Joint Appeal Adopted at Intl. Meeting in Support of Struggle of WPK
articles.content:
Joint Appeal Adopted at Intl. Meeting in Support of Struggle of WPK
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Participants in the 15th international meeting of communist and workers' parties held in Portugal made public a joint appeal on Sunday fully supporting  the struggle of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Korean people.
					 The WPK and the Korean people are advancing the cause of socialism while working hard to build an economic power and improve the people's living standard under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, the appeal said, and went on:
					
					 Stable and peaceful environment is dearer to the WPK and the Koreans as they set the building of an economic power and improvement of the people's living standard as their general goal.
					
					 The stand of the WPK and the DPRK government and their patient efforts to defuse the tension on the Korean Peninsula in a peaceful way through dialogue and negotiations and achieve regional peace and security are now facing a grave challenge of the hostile forces.
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK is a source of the vicious cycle of escalated tension on the peninsula.
					
					 It is a sacred duty of progressive humankind desirous of independence and global peace and security to support and encourage the just struggle of the Korean people dynamically advancing on the forefront for independence against imperialism and frustrate the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 We vehemently denounce the vicious moves of the U.S. and its followers to stifle socialism in Korea and call upon all the progressive parties and people across the world to turn out as one in the struggle to foil the imperialists' maneuvers and achieve independence.
					
					 We extend full support and solidarity to the WPK and the Korean people in their dynamic struggle to ensure peace and stability on the peninsula, build an economic power and improve the people's living standard under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un and appeal to the communist and workers' parties of various countries to support the Korean people's just cause.

articles.title: Unflinching Action against Dictatorial "Regime" Declared
articles.content:
Unflinching Action against Dictatorial "Regime" Declared
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The South Jolla Provincial Solidarity for Progress of south Korea held a press conference in Sunchon, South Jolla Province, on Nov. 7 to declare an action to check the disbandment of the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) and force the dictatorial "regime" to step down.
					 The speakers accused the "Saenuri Party" of proposing a "motion calling for forcibly disbanding the enemy-benefiting organizations" in the wake of the "government's" introduction of the motion for calling for judgment on the dissolution of the UPP and an application for bringing its activities to a temporary halt.
					
					 The speakers branded these actions as reckless behaviors of the "yusin" lunatics aimed to forcibly dissolve even civic organizations after labeling them "forces following the north."
					
					 They held that the present "regime" declared the "second yusin" dictatorship of killing and eliminating everyone critical and opposed to it.
					
					 They said that the illegal forces are the "regime" of Park Geun Hye who took office through the power organs' interference in the election and that it is the "Saenuri Party" which should be dismantled for being a criminal violating democracy.
					
					 They branded the Park "regime" as the "yusin dictatorial one," adding that they would not step back even an inch in the action against the dictatorial "regime" and the "Saenuri Party."

articles.title: Students' Designing Contests Held in DPRK
articles.content:
Students' Designing Contests Held in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The three and four-dimensional designing contest of university students and machine and architectural designing contest of college students took place in the DPRK some days ago.
					 About 260 students from 40 universities competed in the contest, held divided into individual and team events.
					
					 In the individual event, students from Kim Chaek University of Technology won special prize, while those from Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering and Pyongyang University of Printing finished first respectively.
					
					 In the team event, Kim Chaek University of Technology won special prize, while the first prize went to Hamhung University of Chemical Engineering, Wonsan University of Fisheries, Chongjin University of Mining and Metallurgy and Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering.
					
					 In the college contest, Pyongyang College of Building-materials and Pyongyang College of Designing came first in machine designing, while the latter also finished first in architectural designing.

articles.title: Stem Cell Implantation Widely Introduced in DPRK
articles.content:
Stem Cell Implantation Widely Introduced in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- There has been successes in introducing the stem cell implantation in the DPRK.
					 The Biomedicine Institute and the Tumour Institute under the Academy of Medical Science have achieved successes in the treatment of cancer through researches of differentiating the adipose-derived stromal stem cell and implanting autologous bone marrow into patients of cancerous lymph.
					
					 The Kim Man Yu Hospital has pushed forward with the research to implant nerve stem cell into patients with multiple sclerosis and spinal disorder and stromal stem cell into patients of cardiac infraction and other artery-related diseases.
					
					 The hospital has introduced stem cell implantation in treating caput femoris necrosis.
					
					 The Pyongyang Maternity Hospital has applied the stem cell implantation to treatment of gynecopathy.

articles.title: Tele-education Service Popular in DPRK
articles.content:
Tele-education Service Popular in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The tele-education service given by Kim Chaek University of Technology is becoming popular in the DPRK.
					 The tele-education college, which began operating in October Juche 99 (2010), now gives service to more than 150 units in 20 subjects ranging from basic subjects to management of factories.
					
					 Workers and technicians of any job and in any place can enjoy the service anytime.
					
					 They can skip school terms in conformity with their ability.
					
					 Lectures are given in different ways including real-time interlocution and video screening.
					
					 The video screening makes it possible for learners to take lectures anytime.
					
					 The tele-education college accepts its entrants in disregard of ages, scholarly attainments and jobs.

articles.title: Legends about Mt. Chilbo (2)
articles.content:
Legends about Mt. Chilbo (2)
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- When anyone visits Manmulsang (myriad-shaped peaks) standing in Outer Chilbo of Mt. Chilbo, he or she can see Chokhyol (arrow-perforated hole) rock and Puwol (axe-shaped) rock. 
					 The rocks tell about a legend well known among the local people.
					
					 Once upon a time, there lived a man, Han Paek Ho, at the southwestern foot of the mountain. 
					
					 With great strength, Han began in his childhood to learn martial arts from his father.
					
					 When he grew up into a brave man, he had to leave home to learn swordsmanship and archery from a monk called Unhak, on his father's advice.
					
					 But he could not find the monk at the temple but a boy surnamed Choe who was living alone, practicing martial arts.
					
					 They competed with each other in swordsmanship and archery. Losing the competition, Han made up his mind to learn from Choe.
					
					 Years later, Han was able to shoot an arrow into a rock and axe even a rock into pieces.
					
					 When the country was invaded by outside forces, the two youngsters went to battle field to strike the enemies with terror.
					
					 But Choe was hit by arrow in a battle to be in a pressing danger. On the verge of Choe's death, Han got to know Choe was a daughter of the monk, who had fallen in battle against invaders, and her real name was Son A.  
					
					 Later, Han spent his whole life in battle fields.
					
					 Now Chokhyol rock and Puwol rock remind visitors of Han Paek Ho and Son A, who bravely fought against invaders.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers' Frantic Arms Build-up against DPRK Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers' Frantic Arms Build-up against DPRK Slammed
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean puppet authorities expressed their will to massively purchase improved Patriot missiles from the U.S. under the pretext of "coping with the nuclear and missile threat from the north". 
					 They also confirmed a plan to introduce Global Hawk and are contemplating purchasing German-made air to ground missiles.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is a premeditated move for carrying out the "tailored deterrence strategy." It is a reckless action to escalate the arms race and the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula and in Northeast Asia.
					
					 They are paying lip-service to "confidence" and "dialogue" but, in actuality, are pursuing confrontation and war between the north and the south.
					
					 It is the U.S. scenario to use the puppet warmongers as a shock brigade and servants for igniting a war against the north and carrying out its strategy to dominate the Asia-Pacific region. 
					
					 This being a hard reality, the puppet forces are bringing the dark clouds of a nuclear war to hang over the heads of Koreans, going reckless to realize their ambition for invading the north, backed by the U.S.
					
					 They are sadly mistaken if they calculate they can do harm to the DPRK in collusion with their master U.S.
					
					 Only a bitter defeat and shameless destruction await the puppet warmongers as they run riot like a puppy knowing no fear of a tiger, while pinning hope on the tightened "alliance" with outside forces for invasion of the north and preemptive strike at it.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Anti-DPRK Remarks Slammed by CPRK Spokesman
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Anti-DPRK Remarks Slammed by CPRK Spokesman
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) gave the following answer to the question raised by KCNA Monday as regards the malignant backbiting made by Park Geun Hye against the DPRK during her European junket:
					 Park Geun Hye again let loose a whole string of rubbish malignantly slandering the DPRK, urging it to "dismantle its nukes" and settle "human rights issues" during her recent trips to various countries of Europe.
					
					 It is a fact well known to all that Park liked to spend time making foreign trips rather than staying  in south Korea and each time she was busy letting  loose a torrent of vituperations against the DPRK.
					
					 When she talked about "summit talks" with an axe to grind before flying for recent European junket, the DPRK sent a message strong enough for her to understand that if she sincerely hopes those talks, she should have proper etiquette and not to peddle the issue of the inter-Korean relations among outsiders in a bid to elicit "cooperation" in the campaign against the DPRK.
					
					 Nevertheless, Park this time, too, busied herself making more provocative remarks.
					
					 What she uttered during her recent European trips clearly proved that "summit talks" and the like touted by her were nothing but sheer hypocrisy and her ulterior motive is to stand in confrontation with the DPRK to the end.
					
					 An adage says once you get a bad habit, it will stay with you.  Park likes to speak ill of compatriots in foreign countries, forgetful of "presidency." She looks like a meddlesome countrywoman fond of backbiting others, lost to shame.
					
					 Moreover, she changed her dress several times a day and made flattery towards others, uttering some words in their languages like a parrot. She was so disgraceful to behave so.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Crackdown upon Teachers' Union Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Enact Law to Disband Progressive Organizations Denounced
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The November 8th issue of the Kyunghyang Daily News of south Korea editorially criticized the south Korean regime for its sordid act to enact a law to eliminate progressive forces.
					 The paper accused a ruling political party of getting hell-bent on enacting a law for forcibly dissolving civic and public organizations at a time when the authorities referred a motion calling for judging the dissolution of the Unified Progressive Party to the puppet National Assembly for approval.
					
					 It is meant to grant the "government" the right to dissolve any organization that was judged as an "enemy-benefiting organization", a serious violation of conscience and freedom of thinking and assembly, the editorial said, adding:
					
					 The ruling political party is looking to preferentially handle the bill and even the Ministry of Justice began creating a legal ground for the dissolution of the "enemy-benefiting organization".
					
					 What is shocking is the party's open remark that originally it intended to specify the forcible dissolution of civic and public organizations in the "Security Law" but raised the issue separately as many people were opposed to it.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye's "government" is openly moving to reorganize not only political parties but civic and public organizations to cater for its taste.
					
					 The editorial warned that the people will never tolerate it.
					
					 It demanded an immediate halt to the proceedings concerning the bill.

articles.title: GIs Assault S. Korean Residents
articles.content:
GIs Assault S. Korean Residents
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Two service members of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces present in south Korea brutally assaulted residents in Taegu on Nov. 8, according to the south Korean MBC. 
					 The drunken GIs committed a traffic accident while driving a car in the city at breakneck speed. When inhabitants chased them in protest against the accident, these ruffians committed violence against them. GIs' crimes are becoming evermore rampant in south Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Enact Law to Disband Progressive Organizations Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Enact Law to Disband Progressive Organizations Denounced

articles.title: Servile Attitude of Political Waiting Maid: News Analyst
articles.content:
Servile Attitude of Political Waiting Maid: News Analyst 
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- An official concerned with foreign affairs in south Korea said a few days ago that the U.S. wiretapping of phone messages of the presidents of south Korea is a sensitive issue but alliance with the U.S. should be taken into consideration and there is no other mode of counteraction.
					 This is an act befitting a political waiting maid.
					
					 The world is now unanimous in expressing anger at the U.S. crime of wiretapping phone conversations of state leaders of a number of countries.
					
					 Even those countries with friendly relations with the U.S. are strongly protesting and denouncing the U.S., demanding investigation into it.
					
					 The puppet forces of south Korea should make protest at the least to swim with this tide, if they have normal thinking power.
					
					 But their behavior reminds one of a political waiting maid defending a hooligan who stole a look at her petticoat.
					
					 This is actually a matter of small concern to the puppet forces as they leave everything of the country to the tender mercy of their master and feel pleased about it.
					
					 Political servants are fated to depart the world once they offend their masters even though they rendered fine service to the masters.
					
					 This is proved by the miserable ends of the successive south Korean rulers including traitor Park Chung-Hee.
					
					 It is Park Geun Hye's logic of existence that she has to play the coquette with the U.S. and flatter it if she is not to follow in the footsteps of her father.
					
					 It is exactly for this disposition of Park that GI criminals go on the rampage in south Korea with impunity and the upkeep for the U.S. forces in south Korea snowballs every year.
					
					 It is quite natural that the Park group is derided as a group of political prostitutes and traitors by the public. The world people are also snubbing the political waiting maids of south Korea.

articles.title: Anti-"Government" Actions in Seoul
articles.content:
Anti-"Government" Actions in Seoul
						
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- 50,000 workers affiliated to the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) staged actions in Seoul against the traitorous rule of the puppet regime.
					 There took place the "2013 national meeting of workers" at Seoul Square on Sunday.
					
					 Kim Myong Hwan, chairman of the Railway Workers' Union, accused Park Geun Hye of reneging on her election commitments and resorting to the moves to privatize railway, electricity, gas services, etc.
					
					 He charged that Park is the arch criminal violating democracy and bringing the people's living to destitution as she has brought everything back to the period of "yusin."
					
					 Kwon Jae Dong, chief of the Seoul Regional Headquarters of the Government Employees' Union, noted that the authorities' on-going suppression of the union is aimed at diverting elsewhere the people's growing criticism of the Intelligence Services' illegal interference in the election, adding that with no desperate effort can they conceal the truth.
					
					 So Jung Hyon, a teacher affiliated to the North Chungchong Provincial Branch of the Teachers' Union, stressed that the union is expanding itself as the days go by despite the Park regime's crackdown upon it, adding that the union will not halt its actions for genuine education.
					
					 Ri Kwang Sok, chairman of the National Federation of Peasants Associations, declared that the peasants would stand against Park's dictatorship as she is reviving the "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 Sin Sung Chol, chairman of the KCTU, warned that in case the "government" continues infringing upon the basic rights of the workers, the union would intensify its actions against the rule centered on big businesses.
					
					 He called on all the progressive forces to unite as one and turn out in the actions against the regime's acts of violating democracy, reneging on the election commitments and suppressing the workers.
					
					 At the end of the meeting the participants staged a demonstration.
					
					 That day, least 10 000 policemen of 120 companies were mobilized to put down the demonstration, firing water cannons.
					
					 An action calling for abolishing part-time jobs was staged in Youido on Saturday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un se retrata con participantes en 4a conferencia de activistas del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un se retrata con participantes en 4a conferencia de activistas del EPC
 Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, tomo una foto de recuerdo junto con los participantes en la 4a conferencia de los funcionarios activistas del EPC en el trabajo politico con el enemigo. 
					 Le acompanaron en la filmacion Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Pyon In Son, Kim Su Gil y Ryom Chol Song.
					
					 El Mariscal aprecio los meritos de los funcionarios del EPC encargados del trabajo politico con el enemigo diciendo que ellos defienden firmemente el frente avanzado del regimen socialista confiando unicamente en el partido y el lider en cualesquier circunstancias.
					
					 Se retrato con los presentes manifestando la esperanza y conviccion de que ellos cumpliran con su importante y honrosa mision confiando en la victoria final de la causa revolucionaria del Songun.
					
					 Todos los participantes redoblaron la decision de materializar cabalmente las tareas importantes indicadas en el historico mensaje del Comandante Supremo y lo que han expresado en el texto de juramento enviado a el.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae pasa revista a la obra de albergue de Fabrica Textil Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae pasa revista a la obra de albergue de Fabrica Textil Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El jefe de la Direccion Politica General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Choe Ryong Hae, averiguo en el terreno como marcha la construccion del albergue de la Fabrica Textil Kim Jong Suk de Pyongyang.
					 El Mariscal Kim Jong Un dio la indicacion de construir modernas facilidades culturales y de servicios publicos para las obreras de la fabrica, inclusive el albergue.
					
					 En acato a las instrucciones del Mariscal dadas en su recorrido por la fabrica, los constructores militares movilizados en la obra registran innovaciones en el fragor de la campana de creacion de la "velocidad Masikryong".
					
					 Choe estuvo en varios puntos estimulando a los constructores quienes trabajan manifestando el poderio de ejercito revolucionario.
					
					 Dijo que ellos deben terminar la obra lo mas pronto posible bajo la consigna "!Ayudemos al pueblo!" para poner en practica el proyecto del Comandante Supremo.
					
					 Tomo las medidas para impulsar los preparativos necesarios a la continuacion de la obra aun en las condiciones de invierno y proveer de suficientes equipos y materiales.

Angola desarrollara relaciones con pueblo coreano, ratifica presidente angoleno 
 Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente de la Republica de Angola, Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, recibio el dia 5 al embajador coreano en su pais, Kim Hyon Il. 
					 En la ocasion el mandatario dijo estar contento de que todo vaya bien en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea bajo la sabia guia de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Expreso homenaje al pueblo coreano que avanza victoriosamente superando los desafios y dificultades provenientes del exterior. 
					
					 Manifesto la voluntad de seguir desarrollando las relaciones con el amistoso pueblo coreano.

articles.title: Premier coreano visita la Salina Kwisong
articles.content:
Premier coreano visita la Salina Kwisong
 Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, averiguo en el terreno las gestiones de la Salina Kwisong.
					  Los cientificos e investigadores coreanos buscaron la fuente de agua ultra-salada subterranea de gran valor economico, de manera que se abrieran las perspectivas de aumentar decisivamente la produccion de sal.
					
					 Tras recorrer varios puntos, el convoco una reunion de consulta de los funcionarios de unidades interesadas con el tema de aumentar la produccion a base de las recien desarrolladas materias primas.
					
					  En la ocasion se hizo enfasis en que gracias al exitoso desarrollo de la agua ultra-salada subterranea bajo la sabia direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, se dio la posibilidad de materializar el legado de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il de producir la sal de manera intensiva.
					
					  Se resalto la importancia de esa fuente para la mejora de la vida del pueblo y el desarrollo de economia y se debatieron los problemas para la produccion de sal en grandes cantidades.
					
					  Se tomaron las medidas para exigir a los sectores relacionados que abastezcan las materias primas y materiales necesarios a la produccion.
					
					  Con anterioridad, el premier averiguo como se usa la trilladora de arroz hecha por el Instituto de Mecanizacion Agricola de la Academia de Ciencias Agricolas e instruyo investigar y fabricar las trilladoras de alta capacidad adecuadas a las condiciones del pais.
